definitions.definition: In the (same) way or manner that; to the (same) degree that.
examples: Do as I say!
I'm under a lot of pressure, as you know.
As you wish, my lord!
Mom was slim, as were most of her relatives.
The kidnappers released him as (was) agreed.
A nearby to -infinitive may be a factor for choosing 'in order to', as will emphasis.
to

subdefinitions.definition: Used after so or as to introduce a comparison .
examples: She's twice as strong as I was two years ago.
It's not so complicated as I expected.
It’s as easy to do it right as it is to do it wrong.

subdefinitions.definition: Used to introduce a result: with the result that it is; as to

examples: (As) much as I respect your viewpoint, I can’t agree.
(As) bravely as they fought, they soon lost the battle.
Try as she might, she could not escape.

definitions.definition: At the time that; during the time when:

subdefinitions.definition: At the same instant or moment that: when .
examples: As I came in, she fled.

subdefinitions.definition: At the same time that, during the same time when: while .
examples: He sleeps as the rain falls.

subdefinitions.definition: Varying through time in the same proportion that.
examples: As my fear grew, so did my legs become heavy.
As she grew older, she grew wiser.

definitions.definition: Being that, considering that, because , since .
examples: As it’s too late, I quit.
(As) tired as he was, I decided not to disturb him.

definitions.definition: Introducing a comparison with a hypothetical state (+ subjunctive, or with the verb elided): as though , as if .
used before a preposition to clarify that the prepositional phrase restricts the meaning of the sentence ; specifically .
examples: The case is dismissed as between Jones and Smith.
The case is dismissed as against Smith.

definitions.definition: Functioning as a relative conjunction, and sometimes like a relative pronoun: that , which , who . ( See usage notes. )
examples: You strike me as being a very fidgety type of person.
He had the same problem as she did getting the lock open.
I read this extract as being extremely pessimistic.

definitions.label_groups: rare , now England , Midland US and Southern US , possibly obsolete

main_definition: In the (same) way or manner that; to the (same) degree that.
secondary_definitions: At the time that; during the time when:
Being that, considering that, because , since .
( dated ) Introducing a comparison with a hypothetical state (+ subjunctive, or with the verb elided): as though , as if . [to 19th century]
( law ) used before a preposition to clarify that the prepositional phrase restricts the meaning of the sentence ; specifically .
Functioning as a relative conjunction, and sometimes like a relative pronoun: that , which , who . ( See usage notes. ) [from 14th c.]
( rare , now England , Midland US and Southern US , possibly obsolete ) Than .
